heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 09 November 2025, dropping 47.89mm of rain over the 144.8 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 34.3mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (212°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3219 lux) and rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 55.3m higher than yesterday, 32.1m lower than the past week, 45.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 557m to a maximum of 849m, averaging 726.9m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 758.9m and 772.3m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Possible light showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
